summary: This document is a residence agreement and payment record from The Salvation Army's Parkside Evangeline Residence in New York. It includes a letter of reference for a tenant, the standard residence agreement terms, and a rent payment receipt. The document is notable for being included in the Epstein files, with a complimentary card from Jeffrey E. Epstein attached.

events.title: Tenant Reference Letter Issued
events.description: The Salvation Army issued a letter stating a tenant's accounts were in good standing as of March 27, 2001.

events.description: A rent payment of $223.00 was processed for the Parkside Evangeline Residence.

keyFacts: The document is a standard residence agreement and payment record from The Salvation Army, not directly related to criminal activity.
A complimentary card from 'Jeffrey E. Epstein' of 'J. Epstein & Co., Inc.' is attached, linking this administrative document to the Epstein case files.
The primary document shows a rent payment was made for a residence at 18 Gramercy Park South in March 2003.
The resident's name throughout the agreement is redacted or left blank, indicated by underscores.
The document's inclusion in the Epstein files suggests it may be related to housing or financial arrangements for an individual connected to the case.
